page.title: 01Clashnessie Bay Area
page.content: The main geographical feature of the area is Clashnessie Bay, which faces northwards and into which flows a river outflow via a waterfall from inland lochs, which abound to the south and east.The land is used as rough grazing for sheep and there are several small farm houses mainly in the area to the west of the bay, which are still occupied, other crofts lie in ruins in this same area. However several new wooden holiday chalets have been built and sandy beach attracts some tourists in the summer. The main road serving the area runs from south west to east and skirts the south east edge of the bay. The road to Raffin and Culkein runs along the western edge of this area and the post office at Achnacarnin serves the area being itself serviced by the daily post bus from Lochinver.
